intro: Anomotassa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact herbaceous perennial, with upright stems and velvety foliage. Anomotassa thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
